definition: Tung Chee-hwa (1937-), Hong Kong entrepreneur and politician, chief executive 1997-2005
surname Dong
to supervise/to direct/director
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
magnificent/splendid/flowery
old variant of 花[hua1]/flower
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
abbr. for China

sentences.english: Mr Tien pledged his party's support for Mr Tung for a second term.
sentences.chinese: 田北俊声明自由党支持董建华连任。

sentences.english: Mr Tung's five-year term ends in June 2000.
sentences.chinese: 董建华的五年任期将于二千年六月届满。

sentences.english: There may be uncertainties about Tung Chee-hwa's political future in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 董建华在香港的政治前途可能并不明朗。

sentences.english: I was born in a country of Ping Tung Country, farming is our career of generations.
sentences.chinese: 我出生在一个国家中，农业是平董建华的事业。

sentences.english: About 30，000 signatures were submitted to Tung Chee-hwa.
sentences.chinese: 向董建华递交三万个签名。

sentences.english: Chief Executive Tung Chee-hwa was yesterday appointed as a delegate to the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.
sentences.chinese: 特首董建华昨日获委任为全国政协的港区委员。

sentences.english: Mr Tung said the District Council appointment system cannot be abandoned suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 董建华表示不能一下子全面撤消区议会委任制。

sentences.english: Mr Tung's popularity sank to an all-time low after the July protests.
sentences.chinese: 董建华的民望在七一游行后跌至谷底。

sentences.english: Only one in every five people believe Tung Chee-hwa should run for a second term as Chief Executive.
sentences.chinese: 只有五分一人希望董建华连任特首。

sentences.english: The situation reflects the weakness of the Tung government.
sentences.chinese: 此情况反映董建华政府的弱势。

sentences.english: A radio phone-in call asked Tung Chee - hwa not to run for a second term for the well - being of Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 一个电台直播的来电要求董建华为了香港好不要连任。

sentences.english: Tung Chee-hwa's popularity dropped again, probably due to the big rally.
sentences.chinese: 董建华的民望再次回落，应该是受到七一游行的影响。

sentences.english: Students, said Mrs Law, were the biggest beneficiaries of the Tung administration.
sentences.chinese: 罗太说学生是董建华政府的最大得益者。

sentences.english: Mr Tung will disclose more details in his policy address.
sentences.chinese: 董建华将在施政报告中透露更多详情。

sentences.english: Are you satisfied with Tung Chee-hwa's administration policy?
sentences.chinese: 请问你整体黎讲对董建华既施政方针满唔满意呢？

sentences.english: In his concluding remarks, Roy eulogized Tung as well.
sentences.chinese: 芮孝俭在做总结性发言时，也对董建华赞誉有加。

definition: Leung Chun-ying (1954-), 3rd Chief Executive of Hong Kong
Henry Ying-tung Fok (1913-2006), Hong Kong tycoon with close PRC connections
Zhu Rongji (1928-), PRC politician, premier 1998-2003
Anson Chan (1940-), chief secretary for administration, Hong Kong (1997-2001)

Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (abbr. for 中央人民政府駐香港特別行政區聯絡辦公室|中央人民政府驻香港特别行政区联络办公室[Zhong1 yang1 Ren2 min2 Zheng4 fu3 Zhu4 Xiang1 gang3 Te4 bie2 Xing2 zheng4 qu1 Lian2 luo4 Ban4 gong1 shi4]) or the equivalent office in Macao
Qian Qichen (1928-2017), former Chinese vice premier
Rong Yiren (1916-2005), PRC Vice President from 1993-1998, played an important role in opening Chinese economy to Western investors
Lee Kuan Yew (1923-2015), founding father of modern Singapore, prime minister 1959-1990
Sir Donald Tsang or Tsang Yam-Kuen (1944-)
Sir Li Ka-shing (1928-), Hong Kong businessman
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
Chris Patten (1944-), last British Governor of Hong Kong 1992-1997
governor of Hong Kong (during the period of British rule, 1841-1997)
Goh Chok Tong (1941-), Singapore businessman and politician, prime minister 1990-2004
He Houhua (1955-), Macau financier and politician, first magistrate from 1999
Wu Guanzheng (1938-), former CCP Secretary of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection
